title: oneOf
description: oneOf validation  validators  will check whether the user has entered any one of the given inputs or not.
htmlContent:
oneOf

oneOf validation validator will check whether the user has entered any one of the given inputs or not.

When to use

Let's assume that you are creating a employee form in which you want employee to enter any one value of a particular value which contains fields like department, hobbies and skills.Here the field is taken in the form of array and according to that the oneOf is applied on the property by applying matchvalues. Here depending upon the requirement these scenarios may arise.

  1. The skills field in which you want the user to enter skills based upon matchvalues.
  2. Apply oneOf validation based on matched condition in the form, like if the department is ‘dotnet’ then the skills value should be based upon matchvalues.
  3. The Custom Message on Hobbies field.
  4. Shows the custom message on languages field by using messageKey property.
  5. Apply oneOf validation dynamically based on server rules.

Let’s see how oneOf validator fulfil the need.

Basic oneOf Validation

Through Angular FormBuilder service we create FormGroup in the component.

Here we have covered Add form operation.

Next, we need to write html code.

ArrayConfig

Below options are not mandatory to use in the RxwebValidators.oneOf() validator. If needed then use the below options.

OptionDescription
conditionalExpressiononeOf validation should be applied if the condition is matched in the conditionalExpression function. Validation framework will pass two parameters at the time of conditionalExpression check. Those two parameters are current FormGroup value and root FormGroup value. You can apply the condition on respective object value.If there is need of dynamic validation means it is not fixed in client code, it will change based on some criterias. In this scenario you can bind the expression based on the expression value is coming from the web server in string format. The conditionalExpression will work same as client function.
matchValuesmatchValues is the array based on which the validation property is set
messageTo override the global configuration message and set the custom error message on respective FormControl
messageKeymessageKey property of BaseConfig can be used when the user wants to show a different custom validation message on some of their fields. User can define a custom messageKey globally by defining it in ReactiveFormConfig and set it in the message property of the validation.

conditionalExpression

Type : Function | string

oneOf validation should be applied if the condition is matched in the conditionalExpression function. Validation framework will pass two parameters at the time of conditionalExpression check. Those two parameters are current FormGroup value and root FormGroup value. You can apply the condition on respective object value.

If there is need of dynamic validation means it is not fixed in client code, it will change based on some criterias. In this scenario you can bind the expression based on the expression value is coming from the web server in string format. The conditionalExpression will work same as client function.

This won't work if you return without expression or fixed boolean value true or false; like : conditionalExpression: (x) =x.toggle

Binding conditionalExpression with Function object.

Binding conditionalExpression with string object.

matchValues

Type : any[]

matchValues is the array based on which the validation property is set. According to it one of the values in the array should be matched.

message

Type : string

To override the global configuration message and set the custom message on respective FormControl.

messageKey

Type : string

messageKey property of BaseConfig can be used when the user wants to show a different custom validation message on some of their fields. User can define a custom messageKey globally by defining it in ReactiveFormConfig and set it in the message property of the validation.

Complete oneOf Example

This Complete oneOf example which includes all the ArrayConfig properties will fulfil the requirement of scenarios 1, 2, 3 and 4.

Dynamic oneOf Example

This Dynamic OneOf example is executed on the basis of json passed in the formBuilderConfiguration which comes under RxFormBuilder of reactive-form-validators. conditionalExpression with function would not be applied in dynamic oneOf example. This example will fulfil the requirement of our last point.
